NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements:
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En:
In the age of information, the ability to transform raw data into compelling visual stories is invaluable. The Data Visualisation and Presentation micromodule is designed to empower you with the skills and knowledge needed to communicate data effectively through visual representation. This micromodule combines theoretical foundations with practical applications.

The goal of this micromodule is to provide the fundamental concepts and techniques of data visualisation using the R package ggplot2 and to enable you to present and communicate with data visuals effectively.

Throughout this micromodule, you will gain a deeper understanding of data visualisation principles and practical experience using the R package ggplot2. By the end of this micromodule, you can create customised visualisations that go beyond basic charts and graphs.

In the first half, you will learn about data analysis fundamentals and the appropriate use of various charts for different data types. This knowledge will help you enhance your visuals and avoid common mistakes. In the second half, you will create visualisations using the R package ggplot2.

By participating in this micromodule you will acquire skills to transform raw data into compelling visual stories, enabling them to make impactful presentations and decisions based on data-driven insights.

Title.En: Apply the basic principles and methods of data visualisation

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: The student gains a foundational understanding of data analysis techniques and methods for creating informative visualisations.

Title.En: Apply R programming language and ggplot2 package elements and tools for data visualisation

NoteLiteral.En: Students will develop proficiency in using R programming language and the ggplot2 package to create informative data visualisations.

Title.En: Apply data presentation techniques to effectively present visual information

NoteLiteral.En: The student can apply data presentation and storytelling techniques to effectively communicate visual information from real-world databases.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Week 1:** Introduction to history, psychological and physical aspects of data visualisation. Students will watch video lectures, take self-assessment quizzes, and participate in discussions. This will help to understand the foundations of data visualisation.

**Week 2:** Introduction to principles of data visualisation and R programming language package ggplot2.  Students will watch video lectures, take self-assessment quizzes, and participate in discussions. These activities will help to understand the fundamental principles of data visualisation and how to create effective data visuals.

**Week 3:** Continuing with principles of data visualisation and R programming language package ggplot2.  Students will watch video lectures, take self-assessment quizzes, and participate in discussions. These activities will help to understand the fundamental principles of data visualisation and how to create effective data visuals.

**Week 4:** Introduction to visual data storytelling principles using the R programming language package ggplot2.  Students will watch video lectures, take self-assessment quizzes, and participate in discussions. These activities will help students to enhance the quality and effectiveness of data visuals.

At the beginning of Week 4, the graded quiz will be provided.

At the end of Week 5, the student competence portfolio will be evaluated.

The active participation in the discussions all over the course will be graded.

Feedback on the presentation and their work as part of an ongoing exchange with the tutor will help students understand the difficulties and objectives of this module.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M105&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.  

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.

Data Visualisation and Presentation micromodule aims to empower you to transform datasets into narratives through visual representation and equip you with the tools and knowledge to communicate data effectively. 

Most courses focus on either theory or practice and specialise in the principles of data visualisation, data storytelling, or practical visual creation and programming. 

This micromodule combines theoretical data visualisation principles and practical experience using the R programming language package ggplot2 to create compelling visuals.  

By the end of this micromodule, you will be equipped to transform raw data into visual stories, allowing you to create impactful presentations and make informed decisions based on data-driven insights.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).  

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
